attributes.action: UK travel ban and close borders with europe
attributes.additional_details:
(WHO) We have therefore made the assessment that COVID-19 can be characterized as a pandemic. 
Pandemic is not a word to use lightly or carelessly. It is a word that, if misused, can cause unreasonable fear, or unjustified acceptance that the fight is over, leading to unnecessary suffering and death.
We have never before seen a pandemic sparked by a coronavirus. This is the first pandemic caused by a coronavirus.
And we have never before seen a pandemic that can be controlled, at the same time.  
WHO has been in full response mode since we were notified of the first cases.  
And we have called every day for countries to take urgent and aggressive action.
We have rung the alarm bell loud and clear.
attributes.background:
Coronavirus disease (COVID-19) outbreak
WHO calls on all countries to continue efforts that have been effective in limiting the number of cases and slowing the spread of the virus.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300932

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/ 

UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/coronavirus-covid-19-information-for-the-public
